title: Who said it? Elon, Jobs, or Zuck

questions.quote: The biggest risk is not taking any risk.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
questions.context: Startup-risk mantra used in interviews and talks.

questions.quote: We're here to put a dent in the universe. Otherwise why else even be here?
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs
questions.context: Apple leadership quote, widely cited in interviews.

questions.quote: I say something, and then it usually happens. Maybe not on schedule, but it usually happens.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Quoted in interviews discussing long-term timelines.

questions.quote: They 'trust me'. Dumb f*cks.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Real artists ship.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: I'm nauseatingly pro-human.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Interview remarks on AI and human future.

questions.quote: A squirrel dying in your front yard may be more relevant to your interests right now than people dying in Africa.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: I would trade all of my technology for an afternoon with Socrates.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: My mentality is that of a samurai. I would rather commit seppuku than fail.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: Move fast and break things.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: A lot of times, people don't know what they want until you show it to them.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: Who controls the memes, controls the Universe.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: Done is better than perfect.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: Starting a business is like eating glass and staring into the abyss.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: We don't build services to make money; we make money to build better services.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
questions.context: Investor letter framing of mission and monetization.

questions.quote: Be a yardstick of quality. Some people aren't used to an environment where excellence is expected.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs
questions.context: Management quote from biographies and interviews.

questions.quote: I don't spend my time pontificating about high-concept things; I spend my time solving engineering and manufacturing problems.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: Ideas don't come out fully formed. They only become clear as you work on them.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Deciding what not to do is as important as deciding what to do.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: People don't care about what you say, they care about what you build.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: I want to put a ding in the universe.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: I think it is possible for ordinary people to choose to be extraordinary.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: Figuring out what the next big trend is tells us what we should focus on.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: I could either watch it happen or be a part of it.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Early motivation comments about joining key industries.

questions.quote: In a world that's changing really quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
questions.context: Widely cited founder quote on risk.

questions.quote: Quality is more important than quantity. One home run is much better than two doubles.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: I operate on the physics approach to analysis.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: The question isn't 'What do we want to know about people?', It's 'What do people want to tell about themselves?'
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: Patience is a virtue, and I'm learning patience. It's a tough lesson.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: Nothing influences people more than a recommendation from a trusted friend.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: I'm as proud of many of the things we haven't done as the things we have done.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs
questions.context: WWDC remarks on focus and restraint.

questions.quote: If you get up in the morning and think the future is going to be better, it is a bright day. Otherwise, it's not.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: If you do the things that are easier first, then you can actually make a lot of progress.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Things don't have to change the world to be important.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: I'd rather be optimistic and wrong than pessimistic and right.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: We look for people who are passionate about something.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Sometimes when you innovate, you make mistakes. It is best to admit them quickly.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs
questions.context: WWDC keynote remarks on MobileMe era.

questions.quote: I don't create companies for the sake of creating companies, but to get things done.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Interview quote on mission-driven company building.

questions.quote: Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
questions.context: Motivational quote widely attributed in startup contexts.

questions.quote: I'm convinced that about half of what separates the successful entrepreneurs from the non-successful ones is pure perseverance.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: Just stop lying about sh*t. Just stop lying.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: By giving people the power to share, we're making the world more transparent.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Details matter, it's worth waiting to get it right.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: If you need inspiring words, don't do it.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: Our goal is not to build a platform; it's to cross all of them.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
questions.context: Platform strategy comments during expansion years.

questions.quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: I am the glitch.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: I'm here to build something for the long-term. Anything else is a distraction.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
questions.context: Founder letter style statement on long-term focus.

questions.quote: If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: I keep forgetting that you're still alive.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: If you just work on stuff that you like and you're passionate about, you don't have to have a master plan.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: We don't get a chance to do that many things, and every one should be really excellent.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs
questions.context: Product focus quote in Apple keynotes/interviews.

questions.quote: To our knowledge, we are the only life that exists.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: My goal was never to just create a company. It was to build something that actually makes a really big change in the world.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Older people sit down and ask, 'What is it?' but the boy asks, 'What can I do with it?'
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs
questions.context: Commentary on curiosity and technology use.

questions.quote: I think there should be regulations... to the degree that it negatively affects the public good.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Remarks on AI regulation, public interviews.

questions.quote: We are building the new infrastructure for the world.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: People work better when they know what the goal is and why.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: You get a reputation for stability if you are stable for years.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
questions.context: Leadership comments about consistency over time.

questions.quote: It's not about pop culture, and it's not about fooling people.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk

questions.quote: I literally coded it in my dorm room and launched it from my dorm room.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg

questions.quote: Death is very likely the single best invention of Life.
questions.speaker: Steve Jobs

questions.quote: Some people don't like change, but you need to embrace change if the alternative is disaster.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Interview quote on disruption and change.

questions.quote: I think people have this core desire to express who they are.
questions.speaker: Mark Zuckerberg
